intro: Sisymbrium aculeolatum, commonly known as the prickly mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features hairy, branched stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and often have a slightly prickly texture, giving the plant its common name. Sisymbrium aculeolatum is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
